question: Gandhiji was awarded the 'Kaiser-i-Hind' by the British for which reasons?
option1: For his work in Boer War
option2: For remainig silent after the Jallianwala Bagh massacre
option4: For expelling S.C. Bose from Congress
answer: For his work in Boer War
explanation: Gandhiji was awarded the \'Kaiser-i-Hind\' (Emperor of India) for his work in Boer War. Gandhiji created the Natal Indian Ambulance Corps to use as stretcher-bearers for the British. Gandhiji returned the award after the Jallianwala Bagh massacre in 1919.
